content: The safety situation in Western Sahara can be variable and depends on the current political climate. Travellers should keep themselves informed about any potential safety hazards before visiting the region. It is recommended to check the latest travel advice from your government before planning a trip to Western Sahara. Additionally, visitors should take standard safety precautions such as avoiding solitary places, especially at night, avoiding any political demonstrations, and being cautious when driving off-road. Visitors should also respect and abide by the cultural norms of the local population.
